Why Choose Eartheasy

  • A Tree Planted for Every Order

    Your purchases plant trees, through our partnership with the
    Trees for the Future Foundation

    Learn more

  • Products that Give Back

    We source products from values-based brands making a
    positive impact in the world

    Learn more

  • Carbon Balanced

    We partner with TerraPass, sponsoring clean energy and
    carbon reduction projects

    Learn more

  • Family Owned & Operated

    Founded in 2000, Eartheasy is a family owned and operated business, with offices in the US & Canada

    Learn more

Our Story

Inspired by our experience living off-grid, Eartheasy provides solutions for sustainable living in the form of eco-friendly products, comprehensive guides, and informative articles.

Does the idea of using a pressure canner make you nervous? 😬 We understand! That's why our family uses All-American Pressure Cookers/Canners. 🇺🇸 Only All-American Pressure Cookers/Canner feature an exclusive precision machined "metal-to-metal" sealing system. Positive action clamping locks align the cover to the base, forming a steam-tight seal. At the same time, this metal-to-metal seal automatically permits venting under unusual pressure conditions, providing an extra margin of safety over conventional rubber or composition gasket cookers. Learn more about the pressure canner we've been using for decades at the link in bio.

Winter Raised Bed Gardening Checklist ✅ Plan next year’s crop 📝 Pondering all those seed catalogues while the weather rages outdoors is a great way to inspire any gardener. Order from your local seed supplier or try one of the many online sources for organic seed.  Start seeds indoors 🌱 If you hope to grow long-season crops from seed and you live in a colder climate, start your seeds indoors. Tomatoes, cucumbers, squash, melons, and more all benefit from indoor planting while the weather is still cool.  Sharpen tools ✂️ Keeping tools sharp and well-oiled is tricky when you’re using them daily. Winter is a great time to sharpen hoes, shovels, and pruners. Start by washing to remove soil and sanding lightly if rust is present. To sharpen hoes and shovels, use a mill file. For pruners and loppers, use a whetstone, taking care to tighten any loose parts. Once sharpened, rub with an oiled rag or treat with spray-on lubricant. Order new beds 📦 If you need more growing space, winter is a great time to order new beds. Fewer people are buying gardening supplies at this time of year, so you’ll find shipments often come faster and more products are in stock.  Discover articles and products to help you start, maintain, and grow your raised bed garden on eartheasy.com . . . #wintergarden #raisedbedgardening #smallspacegardening #squarefootgardening #gardendesign #landscaping #backyardgardener #sustainablegardening #growyourownfood #vegetablegardening #raisedbeds #simpleliving #cedarraisedbeds #homesteading #sustainablelifestyle #raisedbedgardening #organicgarden #homesteading #homesteaderhaven #gardentotable #sowingasimplelife #gardeninginspiration #igrewthat #gardenerlife #sustainablegarden #cedarplanters

Available in 4 lengths and 3 colors.  The Ultimate Hori Hori. 🗡 The Hori Hori is a hearty, durable, multi-purpose tool built for versatility! It's designed to be a useful tool in the backyard, garden, camping, and bush-crafting, whether you need to cut, dig, hammer or saw. Maine Garden Hod. 🧺 Styled after a traditional clam hod used by New England clammers to hold and clean their catch, the Garden Hod allows for harvesting and rinsing up to 16 quarts (two pecks) of fruit and vegetables all in the same basket. (It's also available in a baby size for little gardeners!) Which of these would you love to find under your tree? 🎁
